definition: to twist words and force logic (idiom)/sophistry/loud rhetoric making up for fallacious argument/shoving false arguments down people's throats
strong/powerful/better/slightly more than/vigorous/violent/best in their category, e.g. see 百強|百强[bai3 qiang2]
stubborn/unyielding
surname Qiang
to force/to compel/to strive/to make an effort
word/statement/speech/lyrics/CL:組|组[zu3],個|个[ge4]/a form of lyric poetry, flourishing in the Song dynasty 宋朝|宋朝[Song4 chao2]/CL:首[shou3]
to seize/to take away forcibly/to wrest control of/to compete or strive for/to force one's way through/to leave out/to lose
texture/grain (of wood)/inner essence/intrinsic order/reason/logic/truth/science/natural science (esp. physics)/to manage/to pay attention to/to run (affairs)/to handle/to put in order/to tidy up

sentences.english: If wrong, you just confess, and not contest.
sentences.chinese: 錯了就要承認，不要強詞奪理。

sentences.english: There was a sophisticated case for this policy.
sentences.chinese: 關於這個政策，還存在着一種強詞奪理的見解。

sentences.english: They blustered it out and swore that they were innocent.
sentences.chinese: 他們強詞奪理，發誓自己是無辜的。

sentences.english: D. Because he hadn't eaten her fried fish at all.
sentences.chinese: 旅行人根本沒喫炸魚，實屬婦女強詞奪理。

sentences.english: My sister likes to chop logic with others, because she is very emulative.
sentences.chinese: 我妹妹喜歡強詞奪理，因爲她非常好勝。

sentences.english: He always chops logic with others, believing he is the right one.
sentences.chinese: 他總是強詞奪理，認爲自己纔是對的。

sentences.english: No one can be persuaded by sophistry.

definition: to sow dissension (idiom); to drive a wedge between
female gossip/busybody
traitor to one's love/heartless rat
riffraff/scum/lowlife/despicable/inferior
crafty/slippery/slyboots
chicken-hearted (idiom)/gutless
two-faced, three knives (idiom); double-cross/double dealing and back stabbing
lit. small belly, chicken's gut (idiom); narrow-minded/petty
lit. Dong Shi imitates Xi Shi's frown (idiom)/fig. to mimick sb's idiosyncrasies but make a fool of oneself
to act stupid/to play dumb/to pretend to not know
sneering/sarcasm/cynical remarks
devoid of conscience (idiom); utterly heartless
to take advantage of one's position to bully people (idiom)/to kick people around
not recognizing one's family (idiom); self-centered and not making any allowances for the needs of one's relatives
to wish for the whole world to be in chaos (idiom)
pinyin: wei2 kong3 tian1 xia4 bu4 luan4

definition: lacking class/boorish/poor quality/substandard
